description: Nethy Bridge is a pretty riverside village in Strathspey the Scottish Highlands This short walk in the village takes you east along the River Nethy. There's a public car park in the village where you can start the walk. From near here you can pick up the riverside path and enjoy some fine views down the river, peaceful woodland trails and wildlife including red squirrels. The long distance Speyside Way passes through the village. You could pick up this waymarked long distance footpath to further explore the area. Also nearby is the lovely waterside paths at Loch Garten and the woodland trails at Abernethy Forest. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Nethy Bridge. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.
